Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very lengthy; all behavioral interview questions, be prepared for a panel interview if you get through the first 4 rounds.  A lot of preparation is needed.  A verbal and written test was required to measure the level of Spanish language fluency among bilingual candidates.  2 video Skype interviews were conducted before the panel interview.  Take notes and be prepared to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to work on a projected that didn't result in the outcome you expected and why.

title: Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interview and onsite interview..they paid for my onsite interview, gave me relocation benefits, helped me with housing.. Memphis city is not that great as such but St Jude is very famous
Interview Questions: it was an easy interview, mainly concerned how well you get along with ppl

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was informative and simple. I met with many different people and they all took in interest in me and put me at ease for the most part. It looked intimidating on paper when I got my interview schedule but it went by fast and everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Please be as detailed as possible - including initial communications, planning, and number of interviews.  Bonus points for your perception of the people, office, and work culture.
Interview Questions: Please try to be as detailed as possible regarding the technical question, business case, etc.

title: Volunteer Services Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process begins with the submission of your résumé and cover letter. You then will review a call informing you if you have been offered a phone interview. This interview is conducted by the director of Volunteer Services, Kathryn Berry Carter, and last for about 20-30 minutes. Lastly you are invited to attend an in person interview with both volunteer coordinators and department director in a round table format.
Interview Questions: The knowledge of OR the experience in Different databases used in various volunteer coordinating offices.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
This is only the first step of application, a conversation with the science recruiter, who asked you general questions, like availability, relocation, salary range, career goals, a little detail about your previous experience. some behaviour questions, like how you solve problems, why you switch majors, which job do you like better etc. 

The recruiter also kept telling you A LOT OF information about the job responsibilities, it feels like they want to scare you away by saying weekend and midnight shifts sometimes... 

for non-US citizen applicant, the good thing is, they do not really care about visa issues, they'd like to sponser, as long as you are qualified. 

When I said I like research, she quickly pointed out, this "research technologist" is not like real research job...but more like assisting others, having the well-prepared recipes, nothing too much for you to explore. that's true. but it's wierd to hear , it may take 4-5 weeks to give you a status update, but if you're selected for an in-person interview, please reconsider, and think about if you do want the job. 

btw, they mentioned, relocation assistance is offered, depending on the distance. the salary for this position is 35k-40k something. not high, but regular though.
Interview Questions: what do you switch majors

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: one on one
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really laid back. My interviewer was a really nice lady, who was personable and easy to talk to. She clearly was invested in the mission of St. Jude and it seemed as though the primary purpose of the interview was to ensure that the new hire would be able to bring the same level of passion and care to their work there.
Interview Questions: Do you have any non-profit experience?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: A great trip. Was put up in the Peabody hotel, got to meet lots of great people, and it was a very relaxed environment. Overall I had a good time. They even brought my wife to see the area.
Interview Questions: General questions asking about science and technical skills.

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy.  I was interviewed by the PI and lab members.  The process was introducing me to possible coworkers, a tour of the hospital and lab and support facilities.  Everyone was very busy, but also friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Understanding of molecular biology

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Typical - nothing special. Panel interview with team.  1:1 with department head.  They asked some behavioral questions that are pretty standard based on other interviews I've done. Some people asked regular questions. Not everyone had read my application.  They seemed in a hurry.  Talked more than I did - I mostly listened.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with an angry customer.

title: Telemarketer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and htye consistently updated me with the status of my application. I had a phone interview, skills test(basic knowledge of computers), and a face-to-face interview. They asked basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Pretend you are selling them something.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Presentation, followed by interview
Interview Questions: related job experience

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2007
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact is usually made through te Academic Programs office.  They will contact you and if they want you to come and interview, will set-up travel arrangements.  Your CV sill be sent out to potential PIs for review and those you want to interview with and who want to interview you are put on your schedule.  It is at minumum a 2 day process, including a 40-50 minute presentation.  

The 2 day process can be grueling depending on how many interviews are scheduled for the applicant.  Also, all lunches and dinners are with potential supervisors (PIs) or colleagues (post-docs), so you are always "on".  

The process is well managed by the Academic programs office and they are into recruiting you as much as you are into getting a position.  They work hard at matching the right person with the right labs.  They also offer a lot of advice on matching personality types - as long as you pay attention to what they are saying.  St Jude has a ton to offer, but picking a PI is the MOST important decision you will make and it is extremely important to not let the place and perks overwhelm you.  Listening carefully to the APO and to the post-docs will give a better feel for how a potential PI is, than the one-on-one interview does.
Interview Questions: There were no questions that were unexpected but it was important to know the research of the PIs you interview with.  This can be a lot if you interview with 10 or more PIs.
